DwdMain module

class DwdMain.DwdMain(external_domain, external_path_global, local_domain, type_of_data, type_of_time, type_dict, load_txt_dict, rest_dict, ending=None, start_date=None, end_date=None, compare_station=None, x_coordinate=None, y_coordinate=None, z_coordinate=None, k_factor=None, looking_for=None, type_of_time_list=None, type_of_data_list=None, unit_dict=None, title_dict=None)[source]

Bases: object

Description

Compressing all the modules into one module for easier use.

__init__(external_domain, external_path_global, local_domain, type_of_data, type_of_time, type_dict, load_txt_dict, rest_dict, ending=None, start_date=None, end_date=None, compare_station=None, x_coordinate=None, y_coordinate=None, z_coordinate=None, k_factor=None, looking_for=None, type_of_time_list=None, type_of_data_list=None, unit_dict=None, title_dict=None)[source]
Parameters

  • external_domain – as string. Choose the domain.

  • external_path_global – as string. Choose the path inside this domain.

  • local_domain – as string. Choose your local domain.

  • type_of_data – as string. Choose the type of data

  • type_of_time – as string. Choose the type of time

  • type_dict – as dict. Should be the dictionary from DwdDict.py type_dict.

  • load_txt_dict – as dict. Should be the dictionary from DwdDict.py load_txt_dict.

  • rest_dict – as dict. Should be the dictionary from DwdDict.py rest_dict.

  • ending – as list. Should be the list from DwdDict.py ending.

  • start_date – as int. YYYYMMDDHHMM. Your start date.

  • end_date – as int. YYYYMMDDHHMM. Your end date.

  • compare_station – as string. Only if you want to compare your calculation with a station.

  • x_coordinate – as float. X-coordinates for your chosen location.

  • y_coordinate – as float. Y-coordinates for your chosen location.

  • z_coordinate – as float. Z-coordinates for your chosen location. (Can be skipped for now, maybe important in the future)

  • k_factor – as int. How many station are you looking around your location?

  • looking_for – as list. What data you want to plot?

  • type_of_time_list – as list. Should be from DwdDict.py type_of_time_list.

  • type_of_data_list – as list. Should be from DwdDict.py type_of_data_list.

  • unit_dict – as dict. Should be from DwdDict.py unit_dict.

  • title_dict – as dict. Should be from DwdDict.py title_dict.

main_activ_stations_in_date()[source]
Description

Will return all the stations for your data type and your time type and your timedelta.

Returns

x_coordinates, y_coordinate, station_ids: all as array, station_ids as list

main_data_map()[source]
Description

Will create some json files, with active stations, not activ stations, activ stations without data and the near station for your location and your timedelta

Returns

“zipped_data_for_active_map” if succeeded.

main_datascrapper(all=False)[source]
Description

Is the main-methode for DataScrapper.py the data. Check the DwdDataScrapper module for more information

Parameters

all – as Boolean. If all==True, it will download all the data from DwdDict.py type_of_data_list.

Returns

None

main_plotter_data(qn_weight=False, distance_weight=False, compare=False, no_plot=False)[source]
Description

Compressed method for plotting. qn_weight, distance_weight are the methods. If both are False, it will make simple average method.

Parameters

  • qn_weight – as Boolean. If True weight the quality of data.

  • distance_weight – as Boolean. If True weight the distance of data.

  • compare – as Boolean. If you want to compare, how accurate your methods are, set True and choose coordinates for a station.

  • no_plot – as Boolean. If you want to see just the result, without the plot (saves a bit of time), you can set this True.

Returns

calculations and graphs (“plot saved”)

main_plotter_stations(projection=False)[source]
Description

Calling the method from DwdPlotter.PlotterForStations(…).plotting_3d(…) and .plotting_height_2d()

Parameters

projection – as Boolean. If projection==True, it will project the height of the stations.

Returns

two times “plot saved” if succeeded.

main_station_array()[source]
Description

Will return all the stations for your data type and your time type.

:return:as array

main_station_information(station_id)[source]
Description

Will return a dict for a station with all the important informations

Parameters

station_id – as string. The stationid with prefix.

Returns

as dict

main_writer(type_of_data_list=None, type_of_time_list=None, all=False)[source]
Description

Is the main-methode for DwdDataPrep.py class Writer. Check the DwdDataPrep module for more information

Parameters

  • type_of_data_list – as list.

  • type_of_time_list – as list.

  • all – as Boolean. If all==True, it will write all the data from DwdDict.py type_of_data_list and type_of_time_list. Else you can give your own lists.

Returns

“data written” if succeeded.

DwdMain.main_dwd(local_domain, type_of_data=None, type_of_time=None, start_date=None, end_date=None, compare_station=None, x_coordinate=None, y_coordinate=None, z_coordinate=None, k_factor=None, looking_for=None)[source]
Description

To make your life easier, this grabs all the important informations from DwdDict automatically.

Parameters

  • local_domain – as string. Choose your local domain.

  • type_of_data – as string. Choose the type of data

  • type_of_time – as string. Choose the type of time

  • start_date – as int. YYYYMMDDHHMM. Your start date.

  • end_date – as int. YYYYMMDDHHMM. Your end date.

  • compare_station – as string. Only if you want to compare your calculation with a station.

  • x_coordinate – as float. X-coordinates for your chosen location.

  • y_coordinate – as float. Y-coordinates for your chosen location.

  • z_coordinate – as float. Z-coordinates for your chosen location. (Can be skipped for now, maybe important in the future)

  • k_factor – as int. How many station are you looking around your location?

  • looking_for – as list. What data you want to plot?

Returns

dwd as object
